title: John Gallaher
text:
John Gallaher (born January 6, 1965) is an American <a href="poet">poet</a> and assistant professor of English at <a href="Northwest%20Missouri%20State%20University">Northwest Missouri State University</a>, and co-editor of "The Laurel Review," supported by <a href="Northwest%20Missouri%20State%20University">Northwest's</a> English Department. He is the author or co-author of five poetry collections, most recently, "In a Landscape" (<a href="BOA%20Editions">BOA Editions</a>, 2014). His honors include the 2005 Levis Poetry Prize for his second book, "The Little Book of Guesses" (<a href="Four%20Way%20Books">Four Way Books</a>). His poetry has been published in literary journals and magazines including "Boston Review, Colorado Review, Crazyhorse, Field, <a href="The%20Literati%20Quarterly">The Literati Quarterly</a>, jubilat, The Journal, Ploughshares", and in anthologies including "<a href="The%20Best%20American%20Poetry">The Best American Poetry</a> 2008."
Born in <a href="Portland%2C%20Oregon">Portland, Oregon</a>, Gallaher has lived in Missouri, Kansas, California, Alabama, Long Island, Texas, Arkansas, and Ohio. He received his MFA from <a href="Texas%20State%20University">Texas State University</a> and his <a href="Ph.D">Ph.D</a> from <a href="Ohio%20University">Ohio University</a>, where he worked for a time as an assistant editor of "The Ohio Review". He currently resides in Maryville, Missouri, where he teaches creative writing and composition courses at <a href="Northwest%20Missouri%20State%20University">Northwest Missouri State University</a>.
